snippet: Confusion and charges of racism suggested the judicial system was not ready for the initial stages of prosecuting 35 educators in the nation’s largest school-cheating scandal.
abstract: Booking process for 35 Atlanta educators charged in massive school-cheating scandal is attended by confusion, anger and charges of racism; sharpest focus is on Beverly L Hall, former school superintendent, who negotiated her $7.5 million bail down to $200,000.

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and ROBBIE BROWN

lead_paragraph: Confusion and charges of racism suggested the judicial system was not ready for the initial stages of prosecuting 35 educators in the nation’s largest school-cheating scandal.

headline.seo: Atlanta Teachers Turn Themselves In on Cheating Charges
headline.main: Divisions Form in Atlanta as Bail Is Set in Cheating Case
headline.print_headline: Divisions Form In Atlanta As Bail Is Set In School Case
